meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

main.docTitle: Genetically Modified Organisms (Control of Release) (Exemption) Notice

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: genetically modified papaya (基因改造木瓜) means a living organism of the species Carica papaya that possesses a novel combination of genetic materials obtained through the use of modern biotechnology;
transformation event code (轉基因事件編碼), in relation to a GMO, means the code given to the GMO by the person who develops the GMO on the integration of a transgene into the cell of the GMO;

def.name: UniqueIdentifierCode
def.leadIn: unique identifier code (獨特標識編碼), in relation to a GMO, means the unique code that is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: assigned to the GMO in accordance with the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development Guidance for the Designation of a Unique Identifier for Transgenic Plants; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: entered into the Biosafety Clearing-House or other unique identification systems adopted by the Conference of the Parties.

section.name: s3
section.heading: GMOs exempt from section 5 of Ordinance
section.content: The GMOs specified in Schedule 1 are exempt from the application of section 5 of the Ordinance.

section.name: s4
section.heading: GMOs exempt from section 7 of Ordinance
section.content: The GMOs specified in Schedule 2 are exempt from the application of section 7 of the Ordinance.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.heading: GMOs Exempt from Section 5 of Ordinance

section.name: s2
section.content: A GMO that is contained in a veterinary vaccine.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: GMOs Exempt from Section 7 of Ordinance

section.name: s1
section.content: A genetically modified papaya the unique identifier code of which is CUH-CP551-8.

section.name: s2
section.content: A genetically modified papaya the transformation event code of which is Huanong 1.

section.name: s3
section.content: A GMO that is contained in a veterinary vaccine.
